title: 113_s1073
content: The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013, also known as the "Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act," amends Section 804 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 to coordinate refinery outages. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013, defines key terms related to refinery outages, such as Administrator, planned refinery outage, refined petroleum product, refinery, and unplanned refinery outage. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 defines terms related to refinery outages. Refineries must report planned outage schedules and inventory estimates. The Administrator reviews reported outages and available commercial data. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 requires refineries to report outage schedules and inventory estimates. The Administrator analyzes this information to determine potential impacts on petroleum product prices and supply. The Secretary is alerted to any outages that may significantly affect the market, and will provide relevant information to refinery operators. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 mandates refinery operators to report outage schedules and inventory estimates. The Secretary will provide information on planned or unplanned refinery outages to prevent market disruptions. This section does not change existing obligations, create legal rights, or authorize the Secretary to interfere with refinery operations. Additionally, a study on creating a national strategic refined petroleum products reserve is required within 180 days of enactment. The Gas Price and Refinery Capacity Relief Act of 2013 mandates refinery operators to report outage schedules and inventory estimates. A study on creating a national strategic refined petroleum products reserve is required within 180 days of enactment, including information on storage capabilities, feasibility of increasing capacity, and the impact on retail prices during supply shortages or market disruptions.
